42f476be-1e7c-4983-afd8-3b2c58ad30ff.description: This micro-credential provides students with the opportunity to get started in this dynamic career with the basic fundamentals of HTML/CSS coding. Students will demonstrate the ability to code websites which include: menus, links, and images while incorporating strong design skills for color, font, layout and navigation. Students will also learn how to apply these skills within content management systems such as WordPress to customize existing websites.
42f476be-1e7c-4983-afd8-3b2c58ad30ff.name: Introductory HTML/CSS

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this badge is to apply for the Introductory HTML/CSS micro-credential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Complete Introductory HTML course scheduled on a semester basis
Project (with a grade of 75 or higher): Create a basic 3-page website with original HTML5/CSS3 code. The project will assess the student’s achievement of the above learning outcomes.
Test (with a grade of 75 or higher): One hour proctored exam on basic HTML5/CSS3. The test will assess the student’s achievement of the above learning outcomes.
This micro-credential is part of a stackable sequence which must be taken in this order: HTML/CSS Intro; HTML/CSS Intermediate; HTML/CSS Advanced
OPTIONAL: SUNY Broome students completing all three badges may apply for Prior Learning Assessment credit for BIT 173 Website Creation with HTML/CSS.

8c08ef4b-fa5c-4e05-a4be-de24f3ff8adc.description: This fully online course will continue the basics of HTML5 and CSS3 code for the creation of websites following Introductory HTML/CSS. Students will learn to code websites which are responsive (display properly on all devices) and include lists, tables, and web forms while incorporating strong design skills for layout and navigation. This micro-credential provides students with the opportunity to get started in this dynamic career by building on basic HTML/CSS coding skills.
8c08ef4b-fa5c-4e05-a4be-de24f3ff8adc.name: Intermediate HTML/CSS

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this badge is to apply for the Intermediate HTML/CSS micro-credential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Complete Intermediate HTML course scheduled on a semester basis

Project (with a grade of 75 or higher): Create an intermediate level, responsive 3-page website with original HTML5/CSS3 code. The project will assess the student’s achievement of the above learning outcomes.
Test (with a grade of 75 or higher): One hour proctored exam on intermediate HTML5/CSS3. The test will assess the student’s achievement of the above learning outcomes.
This micro-credential is part of a stackable sequence which must be taken in this order: HTML/CSS Intro; HTML/CSS Intermediate; HTML/CSS Advanced
OPTIONAL: SUNY Broome students completing all three badges may apply for Prior Learning Assessment credit for BIT 173 Website Creation with HTML/CSS.

6daedb05-31e9-4e81-ae51-fcc6d32d7bd3.description: This fully online course will continue the basics of HTML5 and CSS3 code for the creation of websites following Intermediate HTML/CSS. Students will learn to code websites which include visual effects, animation, interactivity with JavaScript, and integration with social media. Basics of Search Engine Optimization (SEO) will also be covered. This micro-credential provides students with the opportunity to get started in this dynamic career by building on intermediate HTML/CSS coding skills.
6daedb05-31e9-4e81-ae51-fcc6d32d7bd3.name: Advanced HTML/CSS

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this badge is to apply for the Advanced HTML/CSS micro-credential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Complete the Advanced HTML course offered on a semester basis
Project (with a grade of 75 or higher): Create an advanced 4-page website with original HTML5/CSS3 code. The project will assess the student’s achievement of the above learning outcomes.
Test (with a grade of 75 or higher): One hour proctored exam on advanced HTML5/CSS3. The test will assess the student’s achievement of the above learning outcomes.
This micro-credential is part of a stackable sequence which must be taken in this order: HTML/CSS Intro; HTML/CSS Intermediate; HTML/CSS Advanced
OPTIONAL: SUNY Broome students completing all three badges may apply for Prior Learning Assessment credit for BIT 173 Website Creation with HTML/CSS.

4321ae67-7fa7-4f7c-8305-17b8d44bf001.description: This credential is designed to help students develop the skills they need to manipulate digital media for web design and development, digital marketing, and social media. It consists of two courses in the Business Information Technology area: BIT 180 Digital Media Tools and Tactics and BIT 185 Photoshop for Mobile Web and Print.
4321ae67-7fa7-4f7c-8305-17b8d44bf001.name: Digital Media

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this badge is to apply for the Digital Media micro-credential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 185: PhotoShop for Mobile, Web and Print.
Earn a minimum grade of 75 on Final Project in Adobe Photoshop (completed as part of BIT 185).
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 180: Digital Media Tools and Tactics.
Earn a minimum grade of 75 on Digital Content Project (will be completed as part of BIT 180).
Earn a minimum grade of 75 on Written Discussion on Lead Capture (will be completed as part of BIT 180).
Earn a minimum grade of 75 on Delivery Chains and AI use in Digital Media Delivery Assignment (will be completed as part of BIT 180).

9cccdcab-1710-4cb7-88aa-5e98de1d92b3.description: This credential is designed to give students the skills they need to create, manage, track and analyze social media campaigns. It consists of two courses in the Business Information Technology area: BIT 142: Social Media for Professional Use; BIT 143: Social Media Campaigns: Targeting and Analytics.
9cccdcab-1710-4cb7-88aa-5e98de1d92b3.name: Social Media

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this is to apply for the Social Media micro-credential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Earn a grade of C or higher in BIT 142: Social Media for Professional Use.

Earn a 75 or higher on a presentation on their proposed social media strategy or construct a complete social media presence for a business, both of which will demonstrate the appropriate use of social media and the advantages and disadvantages of maintaining a social media presence.
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 143: Social Media Campaigns: Targeting and Analytics.

Earn a 75 or higher on the creation of a social media campaign including selection of tools for creation, administration, and analysis and the development of effective content (will be completed in BIT 143).

6a13a2f5-6a45-4221-b9e4-3ff8caad4a68.description: This microcredential is designed to help faculty and staff to build capacity and observe challenges and opportunities, as well as reflect upon and change practices to support accessibility efforts through the creation of accessible course content, providing support to neurodivergent students, and implementing universal design for learning in their courses and service areas. Completers will share what they have learned with various audiences in support of accessibility efforts across campus.
6a13a2f5-6a45-4221-b9e4-3ff8caad4a68.name: Accessibility Across Campus

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Email Professionaldevelopment@sunybroome.edu to get started on this badge.
Build: Creating an Accessible Online Course: 20 Inclusive Design Tips
Observe: Supporting Students with ADHD: Practical Strategies to Enhance Success
Reflect: Students with Autism: Strategies for Inclusion, Engagement, and Success
Change: Implementing Universal Design for Learning to Benefit All Learners

Share: Learners will continue to refine their instructional/professional practice, learning with and from colleagues while also sharing their practical wisdom with your peers through participation in a Professional Development event at the department, divisional, or campus level (summary report furnished to Professional Development).

938f96f1-51ff-4764-8f62-6de266bbf7f4.description: This microcredential is designed to help faculty and staff at all skill levels to build capacity and observe challenges and opportunities, as well as reflect upon and change practices through addressing implicit biases, microaggressions, and creating an inclusive classrooms and campus community to advance equity and student success. Completers will share with various audiences in support of advancing equity and creating an inclusive classroom and campus community to support DEI efforts.
938f96f1-51ff-4764-8f62-6de266bbf7f4.name: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Email Professionaldevelopment@sunybroome.edu to get started on this badge.
Build: Equity & Inclusion in the Online Environment
Observe: Creating & Sustaining an Inclusive Campus Culture: Addressing Microaggressions, Implicit Bias & Other Exclusionary Events
Reflect: Using High-Impact Practices to Advance Equity & Student Success Outcomes
Change: Addressing Implicit Bias & Microaggressions to Create an Inclusive Classroom and Campus Community

Share: Learners will continue to refine their instructional/professional practice, learning with and from colleagues while also sharing their practical wisdom with your peers through participation in a Professional Development event at the department, divisional, or campus level (summary report furnished to Professional Development).

skills.name: Advancing Equity To Create An Inclusive Classroom And Campus Community

ed818cef-efbd-4008-ba7a-4c70473c3aa4.description: This microcredential is designed to help faculty to build capacity and observe challenges and opportunities as well as reflect upon and change practices by creating engaging course content, utilizing educational technology, fostering meaningful online engagement with diverse students, and designing learning outcomes and their assessments. Completers will share what they have learned with their area/department, division, or the whole campus in support of online teaching and learning.
ed818cef-efbd-4008-ba7a-4c70473c3aa4.name: Effective Online Teaching

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Email Professionaldevelopment@sunybroome.edu to get started on this badge.
Build: How to Quickly and Easily Create Online Video Lectures for Micro- Learning
Observe: Online Classroom Management: Course Design Strategies to Minimize Problems and Promote Learning
Reflect: Equity and Inclusion in the Online Environment
Change: Designing Learning Outcomes and Engaging Assessments for the Online Classroom

Share: Learners will continue to refine their instructional/professional practice, learning with and from colleagues while also sharing their practical wisdom with your peers through participation in a Professional Development event at the department, divisional, or campus level (summary report furnished to Professional Development).

1f0a44e8-a865-496b-af40-702fc20f9b70.description: This microcredential is designed to help faculty/staff at all skill levels to build capacity and observe challenges and opportunities, as well as reflect upon and change practices so that they may advise, teach, and create active learning opportunities to maximize the retention and educational experiences of Gen Z learners, the current traditional aged population of our student body. Completers will share what they have learned with various audiences in support of better serving Gen Z learners.
1f0a44e8-a865-496b-af40-702fc20f9b70.name: Engaging Gen Z Learners

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Email Professionaldevelopment@sunybroome.edu to get started on this badge.
Build: Retaining Gen Z Students: 10 Strategies to Improve Persistence
Observe: Advising Gen Z Students: Developing a Comprehensive Retention Initiative
Reflect: Teaching Gen Z Students: Strategies for Dynamic & Engaging Learning Experiences
Change: Active Learning and Gen Z Students: Instruction, Participation, Assessments, and Assignments

Share: Learners will continue to refine their instructional/professional practice, learning with and from colleagues while also sharing their practical wisdom with your peers through participation in a Professional Development event at the department, divisional, or campus level (summary report furnished to Professional Development).

skills.name: Identifying And Implementing Holistic Practices To Support Gen Z Learners

42fd27be-33a7-41f9-bdeb-31c2e1f53cca.description: The Introduction to Manufacturing microcredential offers students the ability to attain highly sought-after skills in the manufacturing industry. Students will learn foundational concepts in manufacturing and engage in hands-on laboratory experiences utilizing tools and equipment in the manufacturing field today.
42fd27be-33a7-41f9-bdeb-31c2e1f53cca.name: Introduction to Manufacturing

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this badge is to apply for the Introduction to Manufacturing Microcredential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Earn a grade of C or higher in MET 112: Metrology.
Earn a grade of C or higher in MET 121: Manufacturing Processes 1
Earn a grade of C or higher in MET 122: Manufacturing Processes 2
Earn a grade of C or higher in MET 164: Quality Systems

a91d4c40-00d7-4a58-a562-87bf79cf72df.description: This microcredential is designed to help faculty to build capacity and observe challenges and opportunities, as well as reflect upon and change practices to support the continuous improvement of their courses, regardless of through utilizing backwards design, creating and implementing effective rubrics, and aligning learning activities to meet learning outcomes. Completers will share what they have learned with their area, division, or the whole campus in support of quality instruction.
a91d4c40-00d7-4a58-a562-87bf79cf72df.name: Learning Design

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Email Professionaldevelopment@sunybroome.edu to get started on this badge.
Build: Active Learning: Utilizing Backwards Design to Articulate Learning Outcomes and & Maximize Student Learning
Observe: Designing Effective Rubrics: How to Align Learning Outcomes, Instructional Activities, and Course Assessments
Reflect: Designing Learning Outcomes and Engaging Assessments for the Online Classroom
Change: Implementing Universal Design for Learning to Benefit All Learners

Share: Learners will continue to refine their instructional/professional practice, learning with and from colleagues while also sharing their practical wisdom with your peers through participation in a Professional Development event at the department, divisional, or campus level (summary report furnished to Professional Development).

8a2c0d9a-78fa-42d5-8aeb-5f012ed4ebe6.description: Find your voice and explore how you can establish balance and boundaries as a creator navigating the world of social media. This course is ideal for anyone using social media tools to further their professional or personal goals, who may be struggling with burnout, overwhelm, or simply questioning how to best tailor their approach to online spaces.
8a2c0d9a-78fa-42d5-8aeb-5f012ed4ebe6.name: Making Social Media Work

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Making Social Media Work course as scheduled
Read, describe, and discuss the big picture view of social media
Read, describe, and discuss the demands for entrepreneurs and creative careers with respect to the growth of social media
Define effective techniques based on personal skills and boundaries to meet social media goals
Grade of 75 or higher on a portfolio of work from the above lessons.

cebd608a-51a1-4e8f-9740-ebd761948587.description: This microcredential offers highly sought-after skills for Administrative Assistants or Office Administrators. Taking Excel and Access to the expert level elevates the job search for those who are seeking to enter or re-enter the workforce in any office capacity. The Microsoft Office Expert microcredential goes beyond the basics of the office suite by applying intermediate and expert level skills toward solving problems in business, educational, healthcare, government, and legal settings.
cebd608a-51a1-4e8f-9740-ebd761948587.name: Microsoft Office Expert

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step is to apply for this microcredential from SUNY Broome Community College.
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 200 Spreadsheets with Business Applications
Completion of an Excel project with a grade of 75 or higher that incorporates a business model, what if analysis, graphs, pivot table, pivot chart. (Will be completed as part of BIT 200)
Completion of an Excel project with a grade of 75 or higher that incorporates financial tools and functions. (Will be completed as part of BIT 200)
Grade of C or higher in BIT 260 Introduction to Database Management
Complete an Access project with a grade of 75 or higher that creates and maintains database tables, and create and use queries, forms, and reports. (Will be completed as part of BIT 260)
Complete an Access project with a grade of 75 or higher that creates advanced queries in both design view and SQL view. (Will be completed as part of BIT 260)
Complete a project that integrates data from Excel and Access (Will be completed as part of BIT 260)

5b504ddb-b0af-4baf-91ce-d01ab5894f37.description: This microcredential gets you ready for the office - on site or online. Office Fundamentals combines keyboarding skills, Office 365 with a business case approach, and the use of mobile devices and virtual communication. The combination of keyboarding speed and accuracy with fundamental business software in modern settings breaks down the barriers that many job-seekers face for a variety of entry level positions in traditional offices as well as virtual assisting.
5b504ddb-b0af-4baf-91ce-d01ab5894f37.name: Office Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step is to apply for this microcredential from SUNY Broome Community College.
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 100 Keyboarding 1
Complete assignments with a grade of 75 or higher which demonstrating developed skill, accuracy, and confidence in using the computer keyboard and software. (Will be completed as part of BIT 100)
Submit two acceptable timings at a minimum speed of 31 net words per minute with 5 or fewer errors for 5 minutes. (Will be completed as part of BIT 100)
Complete assignments with a grade of 100 demonstrating proofreading techniques. (Will be completed as part of BIT 100)
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 184 Introduction to Microsoft Office
Complete assignments with a grade of 75 or higher to create business documents in Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint. (Will be completed as part of BIT 184)
Complete an assignment with a grade of 75 or higher to integrate files from Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint. (Will be completed as part of BIT 184)
Complete assignment with a grade of 75 or higher to demonstrate the use of business apps on a mobile device. (Will be completed as part of BIT 184)

7d432474-b173-4422-a325-565d39c0b254.description: Learn what you need to know to create and share engaging content across platforms. Entrepreneurs, freelancers, creatives, small business owners, and anyone looking to effectively communicate in a digital space will benefit from this up-to-date and hands-on course. In these 4 weeks, you will be creating impactful photos and videos from your own home, crafting and implementing your own tailored strategies, and navigating content sharing platforms with a new sense of proficiency.
7d432474-b173-4422-a325-565d39c0b254.name: Social Media Content Creation

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Social Media Content Creation course as scheduled
Presentation and working seminar on storytelling with social media creator
Develop ideas and imaging for brand
Create short-form content for TikTok, Instagram reel, Instagram story
Presentation and working seminar introduction to long-form content
Grade of 75 or higher on a portfolio of work from the above lessons.

2bf5c32b-d7ff-4ce2-ba26-d1865086978e.description: In this microcredential, participants will learn how to implement effective storytelling into their video content. They will create, entirely from scratch, a fully-theirs and fully internet-ready YouTube video. They will develop their personal or brand voice and aesthetic through filming techniques, color correction, voiceover recording, and basic animation. Participants will learn to use the opportune platform of YouTube to build and connect on a deeper level with an engaged audience.
2bf5c32b-d7ff-4ce2-ba26-d1865086978e.name: Social Media YouTube Video Creation

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Social Media YouTube Video Creation course as scheduled
Presentation and working seminar on storytelling for YouTube content with social media creator
Film, import, and colorgrade video content
Edit long-form content for YouTube including music, cuts, transitions, and voice-over
Apply finishing touches such as animation, handwriting, doodles
Completed and uploaded YouTube video

9c6fb2f8-483e-48a6-b375-7c52dd763f4a.description: This microcredential covers advanced concepts and applications of spreadsheets in business, health sciences, and service industries. Students will use Excel to explore the principles of cost-volume-profit analysis, create one and two variable data tables, create and apply scenarios with Scenario Manager, use Solver to calculation optimal solutions, work with financial functions, and analyze data with business intelligence tools.
9c6fb2f8-483e-48a6-b375-7c52dd763f4a.name: Spreadsheets: Advanced Functions and Features

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Spreadsheets: Advanced Functions and Features course as scheduled
Case Study: Data Tables and What If Analysis
Case Study: Finding Optimal Solutions with Solver
Case Study: Analyzing a Business Plan with Financial Functions
Case Study: Analyzing Data with Business Intelligence Tools
Grade of 75 or higher on a comprehensive case study on advanced spreadsheet skills

c0189be5-45f7-4f5b-9894-c3c33eab048f.description: This microcredential covers the basic concepts and applications of spreadsheets in business, health sciences, and service industries. Students will learn to create spreadsheets in Excel that model common business or organizational needs using formulas, functions, formatting, what if analysis, graphs and charts.
c0189be5-45f7-4f5b-9894-c3c33eab048f.name: Spreadsheets: Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Spreadsheets: Fundamentals course as scheduled
Case Study: Getting Started with Excel
Case Study: Formatting Workbook Text and Data
Case Study: Performing Calculations with Formulas. Functions, and What If Analysis
Case Study: Analyzing and Charting Data
Grade of 75 or higher on a comprehensive case study on fundamental spreadsheet skills

044ba82a-1f27-4da2-bbc6-a854c00a771e.description: This microcredential covers the intermediate level concepts and applications of spreadsheets in business, health sciences, and service industries. Students will use Excel to learn to generate reports from multiple worksheets and workbooks, manage data with data tools including tables and filters, create interactive dashboards, and summarize data with PivotTables and PivotCharts.
044ba82a-1f27-4da2-bbc6-a854c00a771e.name: Spreadsheets: Tables, Pivots, and Data Management

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete Spreadsheets: Tables, Pivots, and Data Management course as scheduled
Case Study: generate reports from multiple worksheets and workbooks
Case Study: manage data with data tools including tables and filters
Case Study: and summarize data with PivotTables and PivotCharts
Grade of 75 or higher on a comprehensive case study on intermediate spreadsheet skills

5542ed65-085b-4340-856d-d4d5051a220b.description: This microcredential is designed to help faculty and staff at all skill levels to build capacity and observe challenges and opportunities, as well as reflect upon and change practices in order to identify, intervene, and holistically support students in all stages of their institutional lifecycle. Completers will share what they have learned with their area/department, division, or the whole campus in support of student retention, one of the most pernicious issues in higher education.
5542ed65-085b-4340-856d-d4d5051a220b.name: Student Retention

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Email Professionaldevelopment@sunybroome.edu to get started on this badge.
Build: At-Risk Students: Proactive Strategies For Identifying, Intervening & Supporting
Observe: Addressing Declining Enrollment By Improving Onboarding & Retention Initiative
Reflect: Transitioning Back to Campus: Learning Loss, Student Mental Health, and the Socioemotional Impact of COVID
Change: Retaining Gen Z Students: 10 Strategies to Improve Persistence

Share: Learners will continue to refine their instructional/professional practice, learning with and from colleagues while also sharing their practical wisdom with your peers through participation in a Professional Development event at the department, divisional, or campus level (summary report furnished to Professional Development).

skills.name: Identifying And Implementing Holistic Student Support For Student Retention

abfec8c1-49d3-46de-9c0c-cd73b30fdba3.description: This credential is designed to help students develop the skills they need to code websites in HTML/CSS/JavaScript, use a commercial web authoring tool, and understand the business context of websites for e-commerce and digital marketing. It consists of three courses in the Business Information Technology area: BIT 173 Website Creation with HTML/CSS; BIT 186 WordPress for Web Developers; BIT 196 Understanding Electronic Commerce.
abfec8c1-49d3-46de-9c0c-cd73b30fdba3.name: Web Basics

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this badge is to apply for the Web Basics micro-credential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Earn a grade of C or higher in BIT 173: Website Creation with HTML/CSS.
Complete and earn a 75 or higher on the creation of a responsive website with HTML/CSS(completed as part of BIT 173).
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 186: Interactive Web Sites.
Description: Earn a 75 or higher on the Creation of Interactive Website with Web Design Tool (will be completed as part of BIT 186).
Earn a 75 or higher on the Creation of Interactive Website with CMS (will be completed as part of BIT 186).
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 196: Understanding Electronic Commerce.
Earn a 75 or higher on an eCommerce Case Study Presentation (will be completed as part of BIT 196).
Earn a 75 or higher on an eCommerce SWOT analysis (will be completed as part of BIT 196).

05fb986c-4355-4d1e-8734-02ab9d3908b3.description: This credential is designed to help students develop the skills needed to develop websites with a focus on two key development areas: mobile apps and database driven systems. It covers key web development languages of HTML/CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, php, and SQL, and includes project management skills which are widely sought after by development companies. Consists of three courses: BIT 260 Introduction to Database Management; BIT 265 Project Management; and BIT 288 Mobile Web App Development.
05fb986c-4355-4d1e-8734-02ab9d3908b3.name: Web Development

issuer.summary: issued by SUNY Broome Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The first step to earn this is to apply for the Web Development micro-credential through SUNY Broome Community College.
Earn a grade of C or higher in BIT 286: Database Driven Websites.
Earn a 75 or higher on a project which creates a database driven website with PHP and SQL (completed as part of BIT 286).
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 288: Mobile Web App Development.
Earn a 75 or higher on a project which creates a mobile web app with HTML/CSS/JavaScript and jQuery (will be completed as part of BIT 288).
Earn a grade of C or Higher in BIT 265: Project Management.
Earn a 75 or higher on the completion of a team project from initiation through development using project management tools (will be completed as part of BIT 265).
